title: Synthetic Recap
body:
INDIANAPOLIS — In a defensive clinic that silenced the high-flying Los Angeles Lakers, the Indiana Pacers claimed a decisive 101-85 victory, powered by a historic and relentless performance from Reggie Miller.

Miller, the Pacers' sharpshooting guard, was simply unguardable, erupting for a game-high 42 points. He was surgical from the field, connecting on 14 of his 26 attempts, but it was from beyond the arc where he authored his masterpiece. Miller drained a staggering seven three-pointers, each one a dagger that deflated the Lakers’ hopes and ignited the home crowd. His performance was a scoring symphony, a testament to his legendary shooting prowess that carved up the Los Angeles defense all night.

While Miller’s offensive fireworks provided the narrative, the Pacers’ victory was cemented by a complete team effort. Rik Smits provided a formidable inside presence with 22 points, and Dale Davis dominated the glass, hauling in an impressive 19 rebounds to control the paint and limit second-chance opportunities for the visitors.

The Lakers, conversely, could not find a consistent rhythm. Shaquille O’Neal led the team with 23 points, but the supporting cast struggled to provide sufficient firepower to counter Miller’s onslaught. The Pacers’ defensive intensity, coupled with Miller’s historic scoring outburst, proved an insurmountable combination.

On this night, the story was written in threes. Reggie Miller’s 42-point explosion was more than just a winning effort; it was a signature performance that underscored his status as one of the game’s most feared and prolific scorers, single-handedly leading his team to a commanding triumph.
